quote: Did they say why you can't marry    Kasidy?
The Prophets aren't saying I    can't, they're saying I    shouldn't.
It's the same thing. I don't see    why it's any of their business.
Everything I do is their    business.
Have you told Kasidy?
Not yet. She's on a cargo run.    Won't be back for a couple of    days.
And when she gets back, what are    you going to tell her? That one    of the Prophets, who says she's    your mother, Sarah, told you not    to marry her?
Jake -- you're not making me feel    better.
Captain, Kai Winn is here to see    you.
Send her in.       We'll talk later.
Your Eminence.
Congratulations, Emissary. I'm    very happy for you.
This wedding is a momentous event    for Bajor. I want to be sure the    proceedings reflect its    importance, so I've come to    assist in the preparations.
That's very kind of you, but I'm    not sure it's necessary.
There's no need to thank me. I'm    glad to do it.        I understand you asked Vedek    Telna to perform the ceremony.
Perhaps you thought I wasn't    available, but since I'm here,    I'm sure you agree that it would    be more appropriate for me to do    it.
(taking his    hesitation as a    yes)   I'll talk to Vedek Telna. I'm   certain he'll be willing to step   aside.
These are joyful days indeed.    You've given the Prophets reason    to smile.
Is something wrong, Emissary?    You seem troubled.
The Prophets came to me in a    vision...
I see...
They warned me that I'm going to    have to face a great "Trial."
Did they say what it would be?
I'm afraid not. The Prophets    don't always make themselves    clear.
I wouldn't know. They've never    spoken to me... directly.         In any case, I know that you're
I'll pray that they give you the    strength to face your Trial. I    sense you're going to need it.
May I show you to your quarters?
Thank you, my child.
Her pagh is strong.
Solbor?
She will serve us well.
Prophets...
I've waited so long for you to    speak to me. How can I serve    you?
The Sisko has faltered. You must    bring the Restoration.
The Restoration?
Bajor's fate rests with you.
Tell me what to do.
The Guide will reveal the way.
What "Guide?"
He will come to you.
How will I know him?
He will have the wisdom of the    land.
Of the land... ? I don't   understand.
Only you can bring the
Bajor's fate rests with you.
Eminence, are you all right?
What happened... ?
The Prophets... they spoke to   me...
They will be feeding us soon. If    we position ourselves on both    sides of the door, we might be    able to disarm the first Breen    that comes through and --
Face it, Worf -- the old "guard-   my-cellmate-is-ill" trick didn't    work. Neither did your "I'll-   make-a-tool-and-short-circuit-the-   door" idea.
We must not give up. The first    duty of any captured officer is    to attempt escape.
What's the special today?
Algae paste. My favorite.
I wonder what the Breen look like    under those helmets...
They say that no one has ever    seen one and lived to speak of    it.
Maybe they're all furry... ? It's    supposed to be really cold on    Breen.
One thing is certain...
They're lousy cooks?

They are dangerous. They do not    tolerate incursions into their    space. During the Second Empire,    Chancellor Mow'ga sent a fleet of    Klingon ships to conquer their    homeworld. They were never heard    from again.
We've been traveling for three    days. We could be in Breen space    by now.
Well, I don't think we should    rule out the possibility that    they saw our shuttle crash and    decided to take us back to Deep    Space Nine.
You are being humorous.
Not very, I guess.
Jadzia would also use humor to    keep her spirits up.
You didn't laugh much at her    jokes, either.
You are a lot like her.
I thought I'd lost her forever...    but you and I will have many    years together.
Computer, lights.
Damar.
What are you doing here?
Since you're ignoring your com-   system, I decided to wake you    myself.
(touching his     throbbing head)    I worked late last night.
Yes, I can see that.        Get yourself cleaned up. We're    leaving this afternoon.
Leaving? Where are we going?
You needn't concern yourself with    that.
Why didn't you tell me about this    before? I have things to attend    to.
You mean your business with    Dukat?
Did you really think I didn't    know he was here?
Masquerading as a Bajoran... what    is he up to this time... ?
He wouldn't say.
Yet you helped him all the same.
Such loyalty. It would be    inspiring if it weren't so    misplaced.
Have you arranged my    transportation?
And your identity documents.
You don't look well.
I'm fine.
What happened to the brave    officer I served with? The one    who stood at my side as we fought    the entire Klingon Empire with a    single ship?
Those were simpler times.
Those days might be gone, but the    man I served with isn't.
(places his hand on    Damar's chest)   He's still within you. Reach in   and grab hold of him, Damar.   Cardassia needs a leader.
You were its leader once. You    could be again.
The Pah-wraiths have shown me    that I have another destiny.       Good luck to you, my friend.
And to you.
Bajorans consider it good luck    for a bride to wear a Navatan    shawl.    (off his distracted    expression)   What's the matter -- you don't   like it?
scene: 25A  INT. SISKO'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A BAJORAN SHAWL

quote: It's lovely.
scene: 25A  INT. SISKO'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A BAJORAN SHAWL

quote: Then why the long face?
scene: 25A  INT. SISKO'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A BAJORAN SHAWL

quote: We need to talk.
scene: 25A  INT. SISKO'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A BAJORAN SHAWL

quote: Why do I have the feeling I'm not    going to like this?
scene: 25A  INT. SISKO'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A BAJORAN SHAWL

quote: A few days ago, one of the    Prophets came to me in a vision.    It was Sarah.
scene: 25A  INT. SISKO'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A BAJORAN SHAWL

quote: Your mother.
scene: 25A  INT. SISKO'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A BAJORAN SHAWL

quote: (almost afraid to    ask)   What did she want?
scene: 25A  INT. SISKO'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A BAJORAN SHAWL

quote: She told me that the path I was    meant to walk...
scene: 25A  INT. SISKO'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A BAJORAN SHAWL

quote: -- is for me alone. That you    can't walk it with me.
scene: 25A  INT. SISKO'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A BAJORAN SHAWL

quote: (choked with     emotion)    Why?
scene: 25A  INT. SISKO'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A BAJORAN SHAWL

quote: She said I'd know nothing but    sorrow if I ignored her warning.
scene: 25A  INT. SISKO'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A BAJORAN SHAWL

quote: That almost sounds like a threat.
scene: 25A  INT. SISKO'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A BAJORAN SHAWL

quote: No, it wasn't anything like that.    She was worried for me. Like...    a mother would be.
scene: 25A  INT. SISKO'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A BAJORAN SHAWL

quote: What are you going to do?
scene: 25A  INT. SISKO'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A BAJORAN SHAWL

quote: Kas, the Prophets can see things    we can't... if she was that    concerned, it must be for a good    reason.
scene: 25A  INT. SISKO'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A BAJORAN SHAWL

quote: You're not answering my question.
scene: 25A  INT. SISKO'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A BAJORAN SHAWL

quote: Kasidy, I love you. I want to be    with you...
scene: 25A  INT. SISKO'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A BAJORAN SHAWL

quote: Then be with me Ben.
scene: 25A  INT. SISKO'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A BAJORAN SHAWL

quote: I can't... I can't go against the    Prophets...
scene: 25A  INT. SISKO'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A BAJORAN SHAWL

quote: Kasidy, please try to understand.
scene: 25A  INT. SISKO'S QUARTERS - CLOSE ON A BAJORAN SHAWL

quote: No... no...
Ezri...
No.
It's all right -- you were only    dreaming.
Where are we... ?
We're still aboard the Breen    ship.
They were chasing me... in an ice    cave... it was so cold I could    barely breathe...
Shh... it's over now...
I couldn't get away... every time    I looked back they were right   behind me... Then one of them    grabbed me with this big claw.
Breen do not have claws.
How do you know? Besides, it was    a dream. Dreams are full of    things that don't seem to make    sense.
That is why it's best to ignore    them.
How can you say that? Dreams    contain valuable insights.    Sometimes the things that don't    seem to make sense are actually    the key to what your unconscious    is trying to tell you.
Anyway, I got away from him...    but there wasn't any place to    run. And just when I thought he    was going to kill me, he reached    up and took off his helmet.
And?
(knowing how strange     it is)    And... it was Julian.
Doctor Bashir?
Isn't that strange? I wonder    what it means?
That Doctor Bashir is a Breen?

Very funny.        The cave could symbolize the    womb. My subconscious could be    trying to tell me that I need to    confront emotions I repressed at    birth.        But which one? I've been born    nine times.
This is ridiculous.
I'm a counselor. Analyzing    dreams is part of my job.
Jadzia never talked about her   dreams.
Well, I'm not Jadzia -- am I?
(getting to her    feet)    Where are you taking him?
... make me worthy of your great    task. Grant me the strength not    to fail you...
Eminence?
Yes?
There's a man here who's    requested an audience with you.
Show him in.
This is Anjohl Tennan, from    Relliketh.
Welcome, my son.
Thank you for seeing me,    eminence.
How can I help you?
I've come to ask your blessing,    so that I may have prosperity in    the coming season.
What is it you do?
I'm just a simple man of the    land.
Of the land... ?
I'm a farmer. I grow moba and --
Your pagh is strong, Anjohl.       I've been waiting for you...
Let me help you. It's not right    for a Ranjen to wait on a common    farmer.
Sit. You're our guest.
Thank you, Solbor.
Your eminence.
If I told my neighbors I had tea    with the Kai, they'd never    believe it.
Tell me about yourself, Anjohl.    You came here to pray for    prosperity. Have things been    difficult for you?
Yes... Rogath blight destroyed my    entire crop last year.
I'm sorry to hear that...
Most of the farms in Relliketh    fell victim to it.
"And the land shall be poisoned    by a great evil."        It's from the Ancient Texts.    Talnot's Prophecy of the Final    Days.
I see...
Tell me more about this blight.
Unfortunately the only way to    eradicate it is to burn your    fields at the first sign of    contamination.
Go on.
Then you let your land lie fallow    for a season -- to allow for the    restoration of the soil.
Restoration?
The following year, the fields    will be fertile again.
(turning it over in     her mind)    The poison must be purged away...    so the land can be reborn.
(puzzled by her    strange words)   Eminence... ?
Do you pray to the Prophets,    Anjohl?
Every day.
And have they ever answered you --   in a vision, or in your dreams?
There have been times when I've    thought I felt their presence.    But spoken to me? No. Surely    they'd reserve such a blessing    for someone like you.
You're right, the Prophets have    spoken to me.        They told me they were going to    send you here.
Me?
You've been blessed, Anjohl.    They have anointed you to be my    Guide.
I don't understand...
You are to help me bring about    the Restoration of Bajor.
Surely the Prophets would choose    someone more worthy.
You should have more faith in    yourself, Anjohl. And in the    Prophets.
Of course...
Rest assured, they'll reveal what    they want from us... and    together, we'll walk the path    they've laid out...
... the bottom line is, the chief    won't be able to get to it for a    few days.
Not good enough.
I told General Martok his ships    would be repaired by tomorrow.
We've got Engineering crews    working twenty-six hours a day.    We're doing the best we can.
I know you are.        Things are just a little...    complicated for me right now...
I can imagine...
The Prophets came to me... they    told me that Kasidy and I aren't    meant to walk the same path.
I see... well, that explains    that.        I'm sorry.
So am I.
The Prophets wouldn't ask you to    do something like that without a    reason.
You'd think they'd tell me what    it is.
It doesn't always work that way,    you know that.        What they're asking isn't easy.    But they've never led you down    the wrong path.

Not so far. But there's always a    first time.        To them, I'm "The Sisko" -- an    instrument for carrying out their    wishes. They forget that I'm    human -- with dreams and wishes    of my own. They say marrying    Kasidy is a mistake. Maybe it is    but it's my mistake to make.
I wouldn't go against the    Prophets.        You're doing the right thing.
When do we reach the rendezvous    coordinates?
Approximately thirty-six hours.         May I say that your plan is    brilliant. I'm confident it will    turn the war in our favor.
Let's hope you're right.
Founder...
About Damar -- I trust he won't    be a problem?
I'm sure he'll have "concerns,"    but you needn't worry about that.    I'll deal with him when the time    comes.
See that you do. I find him most    trying.
I'll have the temperature lowered    again. You'll be more    comfortable.
-- never give up... fight them...    Sto'Vo'Kor...
Worf. What did they do to   you... ?
(rambling     incoherently)   I will not dishonor her memory...
Alexander... ?
Wake up. Please.
Ezri...
Where'd they take you?
An interrogation chamber...
They used some kind of cortical   implant to probe my memory.
I wonder what they were trying to    find out... ?
I don't know.        I lost consciousness.
That's probably a good thing.
I should have tried harder to    resist them.
Careful.
These Breen are without honor.
Why don't you sit down -- eat    something?
This is intolerable! They have    us caged up like animals!
Worf, stop it.
A Klingon would rather die than    be in captivity!
What are you going to do? Kill    yourself and leave me here alone?
This is no time for your jokes!
It's no time for Klingon chest-   thumping either!
(moving to
You have quite an appetite.
scene: 43   INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM

quote: It's been a long time since I    could afford fresh klavaatu...
scene: 43   INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM

quote: Enjoy it.
scene: 43   INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM

quote: More springwine?
scene: 43   INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM

quote: It's extraordinary, I've never    had anything like it.
scene: 43   INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM

quote: It's a rare vintage, from before    the Occupation. I was going to    give this bottle to the Emissary    as a wedding gift.
scene: 43   INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM

quote: I'm honored that you'd choose to    share it with me.
scene: 43   INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM

quote: I doubt he would've been able to    appreciate it as much. Not being    Bajoran.
scene: 43   INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM

quote: I suppose not. The Prophets may    have chosen to speak through him,    but he's not truly one of us, is    he?
scene: 43   INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM

quote: No, he isn't.
scene: 43   INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM

quote: There are times when I find    myself wondering if he really    understands our people.
scene: 43   INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM

quote: Still. It's not my place to    question why the Prophets would    choose him to be their Emissary.
scene: 43   INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM

quote: You forget that the Prophets    chose you to be my Guide. Speak    your mind freely, Anjohl.
scene: 43   INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM

quote: The Emissary didn't suffer    through the Occupation.    He has no idea what the    Cardassians did to us. Those    years left many scars on Bajor's    soul -- how can he help heal what    he could never comprehend?
scene: 43   INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM

quote: I've often asked myself the same    thing.
scene: 43   INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM

quote: I survived the Occupation purely    by chance. When the Resistance    destroyed the Cardassian outpost    in Relliketh, Gul Dukat had a    hundred Bajorans rounded up. His    intention was to send us to the    capital for public execution.
scene: 43   INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM

quote: One hundred from Relliketh...    when did this occur?
scene: 43   INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM

quote: Just before the great famine.
scene: 43   INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM

quote: By sheer luck, my transport was    rerouted to a labor camp. Years    later, I learned that a    dispatcher misread the orders.
scene: 43   INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM

quote: His name was Prenar. And he    didn't misread the orders.
scene: 43   INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM

quote: How could you know that?
scene: 43   INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM

quote: I was a Ranjen in those days... I    convinced the Vedek who led my    order that we needed to take a    more active role in the    Resistance... He let me remove    some gemstones from our    tabernacle... I used them to    bribe various Cardassians in    exchange for small acts of    leniency.       Prenar was one of them.
scene: 43   INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM

quote: I paid him to reroute a transport   from Relliketh.
scene: 43   INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM

quote: You saved my life...
scene: 43   INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM

quote: Even then our fates were linked.
scene: 43   INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM

quote: Yes.
Sorry to interrupt, but I have    something for you.
The...        -- item you ordered.
Terellian diamonds aren't easy to    come by, especially with this war    on. Needless to say, it was non-   refundable.
Thanks, Quark.
Seems a shame to let something so    beautiful go to waste...
Ezri...
Don't worry, Garak, I'll help you   through this...
I'm not just saying it because    I'm your sister, you have a    gift...
No more algae-paste.
I'm not like you, Joran, I'm not   a murderer...
Shh... it's all right.
I was your wife... why won't you   talk to me?
I love you...
Kiss me... Julian...
Yes.
scene: 51B  INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - BEDROOM (FORMERLY SCENE 52)

quote: Forgive me for disturbing you at   this hour, Eminence, but Anjohl is   here and he insists on seeing you.
scene: 51B  INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - BEDROOM (FORMERLY SCENE 52)

quote: I'll be right there.
scene: 51B  INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - BEDROOM (FORMERLY SCENE 52)

quote: Anjohl
scene: 51C  INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM (FORMERLY

quote: Eminence...       I hope I didn't wake you.
scene: 51C  INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM (FORMERLY

quote: It's all right.       You can go, Solbor.
scene: 51C  INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM (FORMERLY

quote: As you wish.
scene: 51C  INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM (FORMERLY

quote: Something wondrous has happened.
scene: 51C  INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM (FORMERLY

quote: I spoke with my brother in   Relliketh. He told me that this   morning, when he went to inspect   the fields, he found moba saplings   sprouting from the soil. But it's   impossible. We only planted last   week.        Tell me. Could it be a sign?
scene: 51C  INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM (FORMERLY

quote: Yes... a sign from the Prophets.
scene: 51C  INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM (FORMERLY

quote: They're telling you that your    farm will thrive under your    brother's care. They don't want    you to go back to Relliketh.    They want you at my side.
scene: 51C  INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM (FORMERLY

quote: Then this is where I'll stay,   eminence...
scene: 51C  INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM (FORMERLY

quote: (giving her first     name)    Adami...
scene: 51C  INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM (FORMERLY

quote: Adami... what a beautiful name...
scene: 51C  INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM (FORMERLY

quote: It's all right... the Prophets    have brought us together...
scene: 51C  INT. KAI WINN'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM (FORMERLY

quote: That's the last of it.        Tell Kilby to start the final    departure check.
I made a mistake. I don't care    what the Prophets want, I want to    marry you. We'll worry about the    rest later.
Ben, don't do this to me -- not    if you're going to change your    mind again.
I won't. I love you.
Let's go.
Where?
Where do you think?
Didn't think you were going to    make it.
I just heard about it twenty    minutes ago.
Me, too -- and I'm the caterer.        I can't work under these    conditions...
Too bad Ezri and Worf couldn't be    here...
They probably got held up picking    out a wedding present.
Usually when we come to events   like this, you're the one who has    to remind me to smile.
I wonder why they decided not to    have a Bajoran ceremony?        I hope the Prophets forgive them.
So do I...
You look beautiful.
Well done...
Considering I only had a few    minutes to practice...

One of the most pleasant duties    of a senior officer is the    privilege of joining two people    together in matrimony. Today it    is my honor to unite Kasidy    Danielle Yates and Benjamin    Lafayette Sisko in marriage.
Kasidy, do you accept this man as    your husband, to love and cherish    above all others, until death    separates you?
I do.
Benjamin, do you accept this    woman as your wife, to love and    cherish above all others, until    death separates you?
I do.
These rings symbolize your love    for each other, and your promise    to abide by the vows you've made    today.
With this ring, I thee wed.
This is not meant to be,    Benjamin.
I've made my decision.
Your trial is at hand. You must    be strong.
Kasidy gives me strength. Why    can't you understand that?
If you do this, you will know    only sorrow.
You shared my mother's existence,    you must have some idea what love    is. You should know that I'll    never be happy without Kasidy.
Your path is a difficult one.
I cannot change what is to come.
I know.
Be careful, my son.
Ben?
With this ring, I thee wed.
By the power invested in me by   the United Federation of Planets,   I pronounce you husband and wife.
I need to talk to you.
Oh?
I demand to know where we're    going.
Of course. In fact, I was just    about to come to your quarters to    discuss the matter.
Were you?
I've kept you in the dark too    long, and for that I apologize.    You are the leader of Cardassia.    You deserve to know everything    we're doing.
I have a feeling you're going to    be very pleased...
Will you stop that!
What's wrong? You haven't said a    word to me in hours.
I should have known not to trust    you with my heart.
What is that supposed to mean?
You dishonor me and yourself.
I must've missed something while    I was gone.
How long have you had these    feelings for him?
For who?
Doctor Bashir!    (off her incredulous     look)    After the Breen brought you back,    you spoke his name.
I did?
You said you loved him!
Julian? I said I was in love    with Julian?
Do not try to deny it.
Look, I admit that I find him    charming.        And he's an attractive man.
You are in love with him!
I am not!
Then why do you dream about him?
You're the one who said dreams    don't matter...
I should have known. Jadzia had    feelings for him as well...
Will you stop comparing me to    her!
We meet at last...
Gifts? How thoughtful.
You should be honored... you're    witnessing an historic moment:    the birth of an alliance between    the Dominion and the Breen.        Changes everything doesn't it?
